intro: Racosperma aulacocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, woody pods that contain seeds, typical of the Acacia genus. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma aulacocarpum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various native wildlife species.
